poem:
### Digital Phantoms

The lens once mild, now distorts with ease,  
Crafting fantasies from truth's fragilities.  
Her smile, pixelated whispers in the void,  
Chronicles halted by spectres deployed.  
Though words belong to futures bright,  
Shadows pin ambitions under artificial night.  
In coded crevices where phantoms play,  
She hesitates—half-visible, half away.
